**Question**
From the financial statements of [Philips](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5iOWuUx99FWTUNEZnBBNW5aSjA/view?usp=sharing) it is known that a write-down of inventories to net realizable value amounted to EUR 10 million for the year ended December 31, 2016. Based only on the information avaliable, it is reasonable to conclude that:

1. The cost of inventory Philips purchased exceeded the cost of inventory sold during the year ended December 31, 2016

2. Cash flows from inventory sales increased with EUR 104 million during 2016

3. Cash flows from inventory sales decreased with EUR 104 million during 2016

4. The cost of inventory sold exceeded the cost of inventory purchased during the year ended December 31, 2016


***

**Solution:**
Point 4.
